Examples

This section provides quick examples of how to use the sgsim package. For a more detailed walkthrough, please see the full SGSIM User Guide.

Load a Real Motion

First, import the necessary components and load a real earthquake motion from a PEER NGA file.

from sgsim import Motion

# Path to your accelerogram file
file_path = 'path/to/your/motion.AT2'
source = 'nga'

# Load and prepare the real motion
real_motion = Motion.from_file(file_path, source)
real_motion.trim(option='energy', value=(0.001, 0.999))

Calibrate and Simulate

Initialize a stochastic model, calibrate it to the real motion, and then generate synthetic ground motions.

from sgsim import StochasticModel, calibrate, functions

# Initialize the stochastic model
model = StochasticModel(
    npts=real_motion.npts,
    dt=real_motion.dt,
    modulating=functions.beta_dual,
    upper_frequency=functions.linear,
    upper_damping=functions.linear,
    lower_frequency=functions.linear,
    lower_damping=functions.linear
)

# Calibrate the model
for func in ['modulating', 'frequency', 'damping']:
    calibrate(func, model, real_motion)

# Simulate 25 ground motions
ac, vel, disp = model.simulate(n=25)

Full Walkthrough

For a complete, step-by-step tutorial from loading data to plotting results, please see the full user guide.
